data:
1
00:00:20,061 --> 00:00:22,939
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:24,858 --> 00:00:28,445
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:28,486 --> 00:00:31,948
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:33,283 --> 00:00:36,619
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:36,703 --> 00:00:43,251
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:43,293 --> 00:00:46,588
They called this ability
"Tuning."

7
00:00:48,048 --> 00:00:50,383
But they were dying.

8
00:00:50,467 --> 00:00:54,262
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:54,262 --> 00:00:57,682
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:57,766 --> 00:01:01,102
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:01:02,812 --> 00:01:07,150
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:01:07,233 --> 00:01:09,861
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:01:11,154 --> 00:01:12,989
Our world.

14
00:01:14,282 --> 00:01:16,785
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:16,826 --> 00:01:19,287
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:32,801 --> 00:01:36,388
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:37,639 --> 00:01:39,724
I am just a man.

18
00:01:39,766 --> 00:01:43,269
I help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:45,188 --> 00:01:47,816
I have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:06:07,075 --> 00:06:09,369
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:06:09,411 --> 00:06:12,914
Frightened. That's all right.
I can help you.

22
00:06:12,914 --> 00:06:14,958
-Who is this?
-I'm a doctor.

23
00:06:15,000 --> 00:06:18,378
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:06:18,420 --> 00:06:21,089
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:06:21,131 --> 00:06:23,842
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:06:23,925 --> 00:06:26,469
No, I don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:06:26,511 --> 00:06:30,015
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:06:30,056 --> 00:06:32,934
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:06:34,436 --> 00:06:37,147
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:07:29,866 --> 00:07:32,952
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:07:32,994 --> 00:07:34,871
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:07:36,164 --> 00:07:40,710
I suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:07:40,752 --> 00:07:43,004
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:07:45,548 --> 00:07:47,425
I've been here three weeks?

35
00:07:47,425 --> 00:07:51,388
It's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:07:51,429 --> 00:07:54,474
Day and date.

37
00:07:54,516 --> 00:07:58,645
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:07:58,687 --> 00:08:02,440
-I'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:08:02,482 --> 00:08:05,151
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:08:05,193 --> 00:08:06,945
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:08:29,300 --> 00:08:32,679
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:08:32,721 --> 00:08:35,932
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:08:49,571 --> 00:08:54,117
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:08:54,159 --> 00:08:58,496
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:09:00,206 --> 00:09:02,417
Sleep now.

46
00:09:05,628 --> 00:09:10,675
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:09:10,759 --> 00:09:13,470
Dance with me

48
00:09:13,511 --> 00:09:17,307
Make me sway

49
00:09:17,349 --> 00:09:22,312
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:09:22,354 --> 00:09:25,148
Hold me close

51
00:09:25,190 --> 00:09:28,777
Sway me more

52
00:09:28,777 --> 00:09:34,157
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:09:34,199 --> 00:09:37,243
Bend with me

54
00:09:37,285 --> 00:09:40,830
Sway with ease

55
00:09:40,872 --> 00:09:45,835
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:09:45,877 --> 00:09:48,963
Stay with me

57
00:09:48,963 --> 00:09:52,175
Sway with me

58
00:09:53,176 --> 00:09:58,223
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:09:58,306 --> 00:10:00,225
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:10:25,500 --> 00:10:27,085
Excuse me.

61
00:10:29,504 --> 00:10:31,464
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:10:31,548 --> 00:10:36,553
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:10:38,221 --> 00:10:42,517
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:10:42,559 --> 00:10:44,394
What is this?

65
00:10:44,436 --> 00:10:48,898
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:10:48,982 --> 00:10:53,570
I don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:10:53,611 --> 00:10:56,781
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:10:56,823 --> 00:11:00,326
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:11:00,368 --> 00:11:02,203
for quite some time.

70
00:11:02,203 --> 00:11:06,416
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:11:06,499 --> 00:11:10,295
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:11:10,337 --> 00:11:12,756
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:11:14,466 --> 00:11:17,344
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:11:17,385 --> 00:11:20,972
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:11:21,014 --> 00:11:24,142
He was very angry at me.

76
00:11:24,225 --> 00:11:27,771
I understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:11:27,812 --> 00:11:29,481
but for John's sake,

78
00:11:29,522 --> 00:11:33,234
I would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:11:33,276 --> 00:11:37,822
It appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:11:37,864 --> 00:11:41,785
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:11:41,826 --> 00:11:45,538
Oh, but I am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:11:45,580 --> 00:11:47,207
Even violent.

83
00:11:48,875 --> 00:11:53,838
If he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:11:53,880 --> 00:11:56,966
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:11:59,135 --> 00:12:00,637
For himself.

86
00:12:13,358 --> 00:12:18,238
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:12:19,406 --> 00:12:23,743
Mr. "J" something Murdoch?

88
00:12:27,914 --> 00:12:33,169
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:12:38,550 --> 00:12:41,177
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:12:41,219 --> 00:12:44,431
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:12:52,355 --> 00:12:54,566
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:13:24,679 --> 00:13:28,933
I told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:13:28,975 --> 00:13:33,104
I said, "Listen,
three weeks is three weeks."

94
00:13:33,146 --> 00:13:37,609
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:13:39,194 --> 00:13:40,862
The call girl.

96
00:13:46,659 --> 00:13:50,288
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-Inspector Bumstead.

97
00:13:50,288 --> 00:13:52,499
Your lace is untied.

98
00:13:54,042 --> 00:13:55,627
Sorry.

99
00:14:06,137 --> 00:14:08,139
Am I glad you're here, sir.

100
00:14:08,181 --> 00:14:11,476
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:14:11,518 --> 00:14:14,229
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:14:52,851 --> 00:14:56,021
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:14:59,065 --> 00:15:01,317
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:15:02,235 --> 00:15:05,572
-You left your wallet here.
-When did I do that?

105
00:15:05,613 --> 00:15:08,408
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:15:08,450 --> 00:15:12,662
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:15:19,961 --> 00:15:23,423
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:15:45,153 --> 00:15:47,447
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:15:47,489 --> 00:15:49,115
And where's home?

110
00:15:49,157 --> 00:15:52,660
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:15:52,702 --> 00:15:55,538
I'm just doing my job, May.

112
00:15:55,580 --> 00:15:58,124
There's a killer out there.

113
00:15:58,166 --> 00:16:01,503
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:16:05,632 --> 00:16:07,842
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:16:18,978 --> 00:16:20,355
Come on.

116
00:16:24,401 --> 00:16:27,904
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:16:27,904 --> 00:16:31,533
-I believe so, sir.
-Give the man an "A" for effort.

118
00:16:38,331 --> 00:16:41,209
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:16:41,251 --> 00:16:49,342
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:16:49,384 --> 00:16:51,720
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:16:51,761 --> 00:16:55,890
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:16:55,890 --> 00:16:57,308
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:16:57,350 --> 00:16:59,602
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:16:59,644 --> 00:17:03,523
I've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:17:03,565 --> 00:17:06,317
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:17:06,359 --> 00:17:08,778
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:17:08,820 --> 00:17:11,072
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:17:11,114 --> 00:17:13,658
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:17:14,492 --> 00:17:15,952
Frank!

130
00:17:19,831 --> 00:17:22,375
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:17:22,417 --> 00:17:25,253
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:17:27,005 --> 00:17:29,174
God, can't you see?

133
00:17:33,428 --> 00:17:36,348
Let me go!
I'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:17:38,266 --> 00:17:41,061
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:17:51,529 --> 00:17:55,450
I'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:17:55,492 --> 00:18:00,914
What did I ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:18:00,914 --> 00:18:04,626
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:18:04,668 --> 00:18:06,419
should be here, so--

139
00:18:06,503 --> 00:18:09,756
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:18:12,634 --> 00:18:14,969
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:18:23,186 --> 00:18:27,357
I came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:18:27,399 --> 00:18:31,653
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:18:34,489 --> 00:18:36,574
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:18:40,412 --> 00:18:44,582
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:18:45,625 --> 00:18:48,086
Who are these women?

146
00:18:48,128 --> 00:18:50,505
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:18:50,547 --> 00:18:53,341
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:18:53,425 --> 00:18:57,846
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:18:59,597 --> 00:19:03,685
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:19:05,437 --> 00:19:09,566
Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry.
I didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:19:09,607 --> 00:19:13,069
I'm sorry that I came.
I just made a mistake.

152
00:19:13,111 --> 00:19:17,824
If you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:19:29,544 --> 00:19:31,087
We met before?

154
00:19:33,173 --> 00:19:37,010
If we did,
I hope you're still breathing.

155
00:19:37,052 --> 00:19:39,012
What's your name, honey?

156
00:19:43,725 --> 00:19:45,977
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:19:55,862 --> 00:19:57,489
I was just thinking.

158
00:20:02,744 --> 00:20:04,746
What you do...

159
00:20:06,247 --> 00:20:12,545
It seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:20:12,587 --> 00:20:15,048
How do you know
I'm not the killer?

161
00:20:15,048 --> 00:20:19,135
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:20:20,303 --> 00:20:23,098
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

163
00:20:38,196 --> 00:20:39,656
Shoot.

164
00:21:39,257 --> 00:21:44,054
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:21:44,095 --> 00:21:48,850
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

166
00:21:50,101 --> 00:21:52,896
Sleep...now.

167
00:22:24,803 --> 00:22:26,346
He can Tune!

168
00:23:32,787 --> 00:23:36,750
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:23:36,833 --> 00:23:40,712
-It is said he is able to Tune.
-Impossible!

170
00:23:40,795 --> 00:23:44,591
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:23:44,632 --> 00:23:48,178
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:23:48,219 --> 00:23:51,431
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:23:51,473 --> 00:23:56,061
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:23:56,102 --> 00:23:58,772
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:23:58,813 --> 00:24:03,526
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:24:03,568 --> 00:24:07,489
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:24:07,530 --> 00:24:10,825
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:24:15,038 --> 00:24:18,333
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:24:18,375 --> 00:24:22,003
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:24:23,254 --> 00:24:25,840
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:24:27,133 --> 00:24:30,720
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:24:30,762 --> 00:24:34,474
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:24:34,474 --> 00:24:37,310
We must have this man.

184
00:24:44,734 --> 00:24:46,194
My brand, I hope.

185
00:25:01,584 --> 00:25:03,586
I've been worried about you.

186
00:25:08,633 --> 00:25:10,301
Are you punishing me?

187
00:25:11,219 --> 00:25:14,514
If disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:25:14,556 --> 00:25:16,099
I don't appreciate it.

189
00:25:16,141 --> 00:25:17,600
What are you talking about?

190
00:25:21,980 --> 00:25:26,735
I found these keys in my pocket,
so I assume I live here.

191
00:25:29,446 --> 00:25:32,365
-You supposed to be my wife?
-"Supposed to be"?

192
00:25:36,786 --> 00:25:41,791
You really...don't know
who I am, do you.

193
00:25:42,876 --> 00:25:46,379
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:25:46,379 --> 00:25:48,048
My doctor?

195
00:25:51,676 --> 00:25:56,348
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:26:06,024 --> 00:26:08,526
Feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:26:08,568 --> 00:26:12,072
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

198
00:26:12,822 --> 00:26:14,699
I had an affair.

199
00:26:17,077 --> 00:26:18,745
You were angry at me.

200
00:26:22,707 --> 00:26:27,295
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:26:39,432 --> 00:26:42,352
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:26:42,435 --> 00:26:45,271
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:26:46,481 --> 00:26:51,695
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:26:52,779 --> 00:26:56,908
-I'm sorry. I--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:26:56,950 --> 00:27:00,662
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:27:00,662 --> 00:27:05,083
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:27:05,166 --> 00:27:08,503
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:27:08,545 --> 00:27:12,924
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:27:12,966 --> 00:27:15,635
I tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:27:15,677 --> 00:27:18,430
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:27:18,513 --> 00:27:22,517
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:27:22,517 --> 00:27:24,436
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:27:24,477 --> 00:27:27,897
I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:27:28,815 --> 00:27:30,942
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:27:31,026 --> 00:27:35,864
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:27:35,864 --> 00:27:39,701
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:27:39,784 --> 00:27:42,620
You will process
another template...

218
00:27:42,704 --> 00:27:45,248
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:27:45,290 --> 00:27:47,292
Of course.
I'll imprint him again.

220
00:27:49,252 --> 00:27:53,340
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:27:53,381 --> 00:27:56,885
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:27:56,926 --> 00:27:59,220
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:27:59,262 --> 00:28:02,932
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:28:02,974 --> 00:28:08,980
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:28:11,316 --> 00:28:13,401
The police were looking for you.

226
00:28:13,401 --> 00:28:16,112
I know. I saw the papers.

227
00:28:16,154 --> 00:28:19,282
"Killer stalks
city street-walkers."

228
00:28:23,828 --> 00:28:26,706
I was with one of those women.

229
00:28:28,625 --> 00:28:32,879
-Before I came here tonight.
-I don't understand.

230
00:28:32,962 --> 00:28:39,094
I met her outside an Automat.
I guess I wanted to test myself.

231
00:28:41,221 --> 00:28:45,517
I wanted to know if I had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:28:45,517 --> 00:28:47,394
Maybe I have lost my mind,

233
00:28:47,435 --> 00:28:51,189
but whoever I am, I'm still me,
and I'm not a killer.

234
00:28:58,697 --> 00:29:00,365
I believe you.

235
00:29:02,701 --> 00:29:04,244
You do?

236
00:29:09,916 --> 00:29:12,419
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:29:12,460 --> 00:29:14,295
The one you arrived in.

238
00:29:14,337 --> 00:29:17,215
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:29:19,926 --> 00:29:22,095
I didn't know he was still here.

240
00:29:26,599 --> 00:29:28,435
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:29:31,438 --> 00:29:35,191
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:29:35,233 --> 00:29:37,068
I didn't kill anyone.

243
00:29:37,110 --> 00:29:39,988
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:29:40,030 --> 00:29:44,075
Turn yourself in. I'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:29:44,117 --> 00:29:46,703
You won't believe
what I have to say.

246
00:29:48,121 --> 00:29:52,250
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:29:52,250 --> 00:29:56,838
It's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:29:56,838 --> 00:30:00,425
And I don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:30:00,467 --> 00:30:03,261
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:30:03,303 --> 00:30:06,431
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:30:11,853 --> 00:30:14,314
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:30:22,155 --> 00:30:23,490
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:31:17,127 --> 00:31:20,005
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:31:24,426 --> 00:31:27,387
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:31:27,429 --> 00:31:31,266
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:31:31,349 --> 00:31:34,477
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:31:38,189 --> 00:31:42,235
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:31:42,318 --> 00:31:46,197
I can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:31:46,281 --> 00:31:47,866
or the Crosstown.

260
00:31:53,705 --> 00:31:57,542
I'm sorry, lnspector,
I cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:31:57,625 --> 00:32:00,086
but I am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:32:00,128 --> 00:32:02,797
Well, I appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:32:13,683 --> 00:32:16,728
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:32:16,770 --> 00:32:22,442
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:32:22,484 --> 00:32:25,904
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:32:25,945 --> 00:32:29,908
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:32:29,949 --> 00:32:33,536
Well, I do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:32:33,620 --> 00:32:38,875
Inspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:32:38,875 --> 00:32:41,378
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:32:41,419 --> 00:32:46,383
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:32:46,424 --> 00:32:50,303
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:32:50,387 --> 00:32:53,223
Consumed by details.

273
00:32:53,264 --> 00:32:57,644
I would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:32:57,686 --> 00:33:00,939
Good evening, lnspector.
I really must be going.

275
00:33:48,153 --> 00:33:49,529
Come in.

276
00:33:55,785 --> 00:33:57,996
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:33:59,622 --> 00:34:02,917
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

278
00:34:10,884 --> 00:34:12,385
Come in, Frank.

279
00:34:16,473 --> 00:34:17,974
Close the door.

280
00:34:28,026 --> 00:34:32,155
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:34:32,197 --> 00:34:34,824
It's an interesting case.

282
00:34:36,242 --> 00:34:40,246
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:34:42,374 --> 00:34:46,920
-Or break it.
-Yeah. I was on that case.

284
00:34:46,961 --> 00:34:51,758
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:34:51,800 --> 00:34:53,593
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:34:54,886 --> 00:34:57,389
I've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:34:57,430 --> 00:34:59,849
riding in circles.

288
00:34:59,891 --> 00:35:04,312
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:35:07,148 --> 00:35:09,234
I've been over this entire city.

290
00:35:14,864 --> 00:35:17,200
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:35:17,242 --> 00:35:19,119
She's not my wife.

292
00:35:21,413 --> 00:35:25,125
I don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:35:25,166 --> 00:35:29,421
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:35:31,965 --> 00:35:33,842
As much as the next guy.

295
00:35:35,093 --> 00:35:38,513
See, I've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:35:38,596 --> 00:35:42,434
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:35:42,475 --> 00:35:45,186
But the more
I try to think back,

298
00:35:45,270 --> 00:35:49,024
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:35:49,065 --> 00:35:50,525
None of it seems real.

300
00:35:50,525 --> 00:35:55,739
It's like I've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:35:55,780 --> 00:35:59,492
and when I finally wake up,
I'll be somebody else,

302
00:35:59,534 --> 00:36:02,037
somebody totally different.

303
00:36:07,500 --> 00:36:10,211
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:36:11,629 --> 00:36:14,799
Something to do with the case.

305
00:36:15,550 --> 00:36:19,763
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:36:19,804 --> 00:36:24,726
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

307
00:37:16,027 --> 00:37:18,196
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:37:18,279 --> 00:37:22,325
12 family photo albums,

309
00:37:22,367 --> 00:37:25,412
nine personal diaries,

310
00:37:25,453 --> 00:37:28,123
17 love letters,

311
00:37:28,164 --> 00:37:31,209
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:37:31,251 --> 00:37:36,464
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:37:36,506 --> 00:37:39,384
These do bring back memories.

314
00:37:42,303 --> 00:37:45,181
This one is still warm.

315
00:37:46,141 --> 00:37:47,559
What is it?

316
00:37:47,600 --> 00:37:51,646
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:37:51,688 --> 00:37:54,566
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:37:55,442 --> 00:37:57,318
We will soon find out.

319
00:37:58,945 --> 00:38:00,822
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:38:00,864 --> 00:38:04,868
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:38:04,909 --> 00:38:10,290
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:38:11,291 --> 00:38:12,917
Let's see.

323
00:38:14,502 --> 00:38:17,922
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:38:25,013 --> 00:38:28,224
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:38:30,226 --> 00:38:34,064
And last but not least...

326
00:38:34,105 --> 00:38:37,359
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:38:40,904 --> 00:38:42,989
Mr. Book.

328
00:38:51,748 --> 00:38:56,211
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:38:56,294 --> 00:39:01,591
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:39:01,633 --> 00:39:03,176
A freak of nature.

331
00:39:03,218 --> 00:39:06,763
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:39:06,805 --> 00:39:09,224
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:39:09,265 --> 00:39:12,560
Isn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:39:12,602 --> 00:39:16,773
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:39:16,815 --> 00:39:20,402
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:39:20,485 --> 00:39:22,404
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:39:27,450 --> 00:39:29,869
It requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:39:29,911 --> 00:39:31,996
to master our gifts.

339
00:39:32,038 --> 00:39:34,290
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:39:34,332 --> 00:39:36,835
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:39:36,876 --> 00:39:38,294
Absurd, I know.

342
00:39:38,336 --> 00:39:41,214
What other explanation is there?

343
00:39:47,429 --> 00:39:48,888
It is time.

344
00:40:46,279 --> 00:40:48,114
Shut it down.

345
00:41:11,262 --> 00:41:15,183
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:41:15,225 --> 00:41:17,519
It's about time, dear.

347
00:42:20,957 --> 00:42:22,208
Hello?

348
00:42:32,594 --> 00:42:34,262
Wake up.

349
00:42:38,183 --> 00:42:40,060
Wake up!

350
00:42:52,614 --> 00:42:55,325
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:42:59,287 --> 00:43:02,832
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:46:22,615 --> 00:46:24,325
The Goodwins.

353
00:46:24,367 --> 00:46:26,870
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:46:26,953 --> 00:46:29,539
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:46:34,377 --> 00:46:37,172
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:47:14,834 --> 00:47:17,671
The rich get richer.

357
00:47:17,712 --> 00:47:20,340
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:47:20,423 --> 00:47:22,092
before the night
is through.

359
00:48:29,034 --> 00:48:31,494
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

360
00:48:31,536 --> 00:48:33,413
It's you.

361
00:48:33,455 --> 00:48:34,789
Hey, come on.

362
00:48:34,831 --> 00:48:37,500
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:48:37,542 --> 00:48:40,211
if that's what you are.

364
00:48:40,253 --> 00:48:42,088
Please, l--

365
00:48:42,130 --> 00:48:44,424
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:48:44,466 --> 00:48:47,427
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:48:47,510 --> 00:48:49,888
I can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:48:49,929 --> 00:48:53,433
Nothing. I want to help you.

369
00:48:53,475 --> 00:48:57,771
We cannot talk here.
If they see us together--

370
00:48:57,812 --> 00:49:01,399
I don't care.
I want some answers. Now!

371
00:49:01,483 --> 00:49:05,362
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:49:05,445 --> 00:49:06,821
Answer me!

373
00:49:13,203 --> 00:49:14,496
My God.

374
00:49:14,537 --> 00:49:18,375
-You really can do it.
-I did that?

375
00:49:18,416 --> 00:49:21,711
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:49:21,753 --> 00:49:24,214
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:49:24,255 --> 00:49:26,216
They call it "Tuning."

378
00:49:26,299 --> 00:49:28,718
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:49:28,802 --> 00:49:31,930
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:49:32,013 --> 00:49:35,475
but I can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:49:35,517 --> 00:49:40,480
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:49:44,651 --> 00:49:46,528
My glasses.

383
00:50:54,304 --> 00:50:57,223
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:50:57,265 --> 00:51:00,810
Iollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:51:00,852 --> 00:51:04,439
So I told Fredrickson
I was letting him go.

386
00:51:04,522 --> 00:51:07,025
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:51:07,901 --> 00:51:11,738
He attacked me.
I don't know where he's gone.

388
00:51:12,364 --> 00:51:17,327
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:51:17,369 --> 00:51:20,622
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:51:23,625 --> 00:51:31,675
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:51:33,009 --> 00:51:43,103
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:51:46,690 --> 00:51:55,240
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:51:57,283 --> 00:52:04,624
I'll know, believe me, I'll know

394
00:52:06,459 --> 00:52:10,839
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:52:10,880 --> 00:52:15,927
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:52:15,969 --> 00:52:19,723
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:52:19,806 --> 00:52:21,766
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:52:21,808 --> 00:52:24,185
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:52:24,227 --> 00:52:28,565
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:52:28,606 --> 00:52:32,652
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:52:32,736 --> 00:52:37,991
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:52:38,033 --> 00:52:40,493
He is becoming like us.

403
00:52:40,493 --> 00:52:44,831
So we must become like him.

404
00:52:45,957 --> 00:52:48,877
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:52:48,918 --> 00:52:53,590
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:52:56,092 --> 00:52:59,304
We must not do this.

407
00:52:59,346 --> 00:53:03,600
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:53:03,641 --> 00:53:07,187
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:53:07,228 --> 00:53:11,524
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:53:11,566 --> 00:53:13,109
will be known to us.

411
00:53:13,193 --> 00:53:19,574
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:53:19,657 --> 00:53:22,660
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:53:22,702 --> 00:53:26,122
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:53:26,164 --> 00:53:30,585
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:53:30,627 --> 00:53:32,671
Imprint.

416
00:53:39,469 --> 00:53:41,846
This may sting a bit.

417
00:54:27,475 --> 00:54:29,602
Is it done?

418
00:54:29,644 --> 00:54:32,689
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:54:32,731 --> 00:54:37,527
I have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:54:38,361 --> 00:54:40,363
"Johnny...

421
00:54:40,405 --> 00:54:45,410
"Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:54:45,452 --> 00:54:48,288
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:54:48,329 --> 00:54:50,623
"Stop by sometime.

424
00:54:50,665 --> 00:54:54,794
"We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:54:54,836 --> 00:54:57,714
"Love to Emma. Karl."

426
00:55:04,596 --> 00:55:05,805
Karl.

427
00:55:08,141 --> 00:55:10,226
Karl Harris.

428
00:55:20,445 --> 00:55:21,738
Harris.

429
00:55:32,123 --> 00:55:35,919
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:55:35,960 --> 00:55:37,545
Try the subway.

431
00:55:42,175 --> 00:55:44,052
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:55:44,094 --> 00:55:47,639
Been working here long?

433
00:55:47,722 --> 00:55:51,893
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:56:23,299 --> 00:56:26,970
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:57:09,763 --> 00:57:12,390
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:57:12,432 --> 00:57:14,726
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:57:14,768 --> 00:57:18,229
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:57:18,271 --> 00:57:21,399
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:57:21,441 --> 00:57:26,488
-This is irrational.
-Instincts are irrational.

440
00:57:26,571 --> 00:57:30,658
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:57:30,742 --> 00:57:34,788
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:57:34,829 --> 00:57:36,498
His job.

443
00:57:36,581 --> 00:57:39,125
He does not care about our job.

444
00:57:39,125 --> 00:57:42,671
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:57:42,712 --> 00:57:46,049
If you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:57:46,091 --> 00:57:50,261
If I were Murdoch...

447
00:57:52,514 --> 00:57:56,893
I would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:57:56,935 --> 00:57:59,521
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:58:01,439 --> 00:58:03,316
And then...

450
00:58:05,694 --> 00:58:09,989
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:58:13,743 --> 00:58:19,457
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:58:24,045 --> 00:58:26,673
All change,
platform three.

453
00:58:30,051 --> 00:58:31,428
All change?

454
00:58:31,469 --> 00:58:34,389
Excuse me, how do I get
to the end of the line?

455
00:58:34,389 --> 00:58:36,266
You want the Express.

456
00:58:51,990 --> 00:58:55,076
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:58:55,118 --> 00:58:56,745
That's the Express.

458
00:58:58,663 --> 00:59:01,082
There's no way out.

459
00:59:01,124 --> 00:59:04,627
You can't get out of the city.
I've tried.

460
00:59:06,046 --> 00:59:08,631
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:59:08,673 --> 00:59:10,759
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:59:10,842 --> 00:59:12,218
You're not a killer.

463
00:59:12,302 --> 00:59:15,680
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:59:15,722 --> 00:59:17,766
Iike everyone else here.

465
00:59:17,807 --> 00:59:20,226
-Who are you?
-I was a cop.

466
00:59:20,268 --> 00:59:24,189
At least in this life I was.

467
00:59:24,230 --> 00:59:27,776
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:59:27,817 --> 00:59:30,070
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:59:30,111 --> 00:59:33,490
I seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:59:33,573 --> 00:59:36,201
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:59:36,284 --> 00:59:37,869
How do you know all this?

472
00:59:37,952 --> 00:59:40,163
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:59:40,246 --> 00:59:41,998
while they're changing things.

474
00:59:43,166 --> 00:59:46,294
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:59:46,336 --> 00:59:48,004
It happened to me.

476
00:59:48,838 --> 00:59:51,216
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:59:52,634 --> 00:59:55,553
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:59:55,595 --> 00:59:57,389
But that's OK.

479
00:59:57,389 --> 00:59:58,932
I figured a way out.

480
01:00:13,238 --> 01:00:14,781
They were here.

481
01:00:17,409 --> 01:00:19,160
Last night.

482
01:00:19,244 --> 01:00:21,996
This was to be his home.

483
01:00:25,333 --> 01:00:27,585
That was when we loved her.

484
01:00:27,627 --> 01:00:30,547
This is all well and good,

485
01:00:30,588 --> 01:00:33,091
but we require
a more practical link...

486
01:00:33,133 --> 01:00:35,719
to his present whereabouts.

487
01:00:41,474 --> 01:00:44,060
And I know where to find her.

488
01:00:54,571 --> 01:00:58,700
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
01:00:58,742 --> 01:01:00,035
I'm sorry?

490
01:01:00,118 --> 01:01:02,662
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
01:01:02,704 --> 01:01:05,206
which meant
so very much to us.

492
01:01:06,249 --> 01:01:09,419
I thought we were haunted
by them.

493
01:01:09,502 --> 01:01:11,629
Perhaps.

494
01:01:11,671 --> 01:01:14,758
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

495
01:01:14,799 --> 01:01:17,427
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
01:01:17,469 --> 01:01:21,014
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
01:01:22,724 --> 01:01:25,977
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
01:01:26,019 --> 01:01:27,937
On this very spot.

499
01:01:29,814 --> 01:01:32,442
Where is your husband now?

500
01:01:32,484 --> 01:01:37,280
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

501
01:01:37,280 --> 01:01:40,867
I met my wife at this place.

502
01:01:40,909 --> 01:01:43,745
It's where I met my husband.

503
01:01:43,787 --> 01:01:45,663
Small world.

504
01:02:53,356 --> 01:02:54,607
Hello?

505
01:03:53,750 --> 01:03:56,127
What are you doing here?

506
01:03:56,169 --> 01:03:58,213
I've been following you.

507
01:04:03,093 --> 01:04:05,220
Hold it right there!

508
01:04:07,847 --> 01:04:09,057
Johnny?

509
01:04:12,936 --> 01:04:14,562
It's been so damn long,

510
01:04:14,604 --> 01:04:17,273
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
01:04:18,775 --> 01:04:20,568
You son of a gun!

512
01:04:24,823 --> 01:04:26,366
Uncle Karl...

513
01:04:30,203 --> 01:04:31,454
Wait.

514
01:04:35,041 --> 01:04:37,711
-Is that me?
-Yeah.

515
01:04:48,096 --> 01:04:50,265
Shell Beach is where
I grew up?

516
01:04:50,348 --> 01:04:53,601
That's what I said.
Shell Beach.

517
01:04:53,685 --> 01:04:56,688
-Your home town.
-I need to get there.

518
01:04:56,730 --> 01:04:58,064
How do I get there?

519
01:04:59,816 --> 01:05:03,486
I don't know.
I haven't been there in years.

520
01:05:03,528 --> 01:05:07,115
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
01:05:09,576 --> 01:05:11,119
Sorry, Johnny.

522
01:05:12,912 --> 01:05:16,082
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
01:05:20,837 --> 01:05:25,175
-It was so bright there.
-Brighter times, I guess.

524
01:05:27,344 --> 01:05:31,473
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
01:05:31,514 --> 01:05:33,975
That's me and your Pa.

526
01:05:34,017 --> 01:05:36,936
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
01:05:36,978 --> 01:05:38,938
What happened to my parents?

528
01:05:42,108 --> 01:05:43,526
Where are they now?

529
01:05:45,070 --> 01:05:47,322
They're dead, Johnny.

530
01:05:47,364 --> 01:05:50,825
They died when the house
burned down.

531
01:05:50,867 --> 01:05:52,911
I looked after you.

532
01:05:54,037 --> 01:05:56,247
You don't remember that,
really?

533
01:05:59,793 --> 01:06:02,921
What's that? What is that?

534
01:06:10,220 --> 01:06:12,555
It's a scar.

535
01:06:12,555 --> 01:06:15,475
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
01:06:22,440 --> 01:06:24,401
What does it mean?

537
01:06:24,442 --> 01:06:26,945
It means these are all lies!

538
01:06:32,033 --> 01:06:34,953
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
01:06:35,036 --> 01:06:38,498
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
01:06:38,581 --> 01:06:41,418
See if he was...

541
01:06:41,501 --> 01:06:44,421
capable of...

542
01:06:55,515 --> 01:06:57,809
I wanted to talk to her.

543
01:06:57,851 --> 01:07:00,311
I thought she could
help me find him.

544
01:07:02,439 --> 01:07:04,941
I'm going to call the station.

545
01:07:25,128 --> 01:07:26,671
It's beautiful.

546
01:07:30,008 --> 01:07:33,553
It was a gift from my mother.

547
01:07:33,636 --> 01:07:35,555
She died recently.

548
01:07:37,265 --> 01:07:40,143
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
01:07:42,812 --> 01:07:44,105
I'm sorry.

550
01:07:48,693 --> 01:07:51,363
It's a funny thing, though.

551
01:07:51,404 --> 01:07:54,491
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
01:07:57,535 --> 01:08:00,580
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

553
01:08:02,457 --> 01:08:05,543
What's happening, lnspector?

554
01:08:05,585 --> 01:08:07,837
I'm not sure I know anymore.

555
01:08:12,842 --> 01:08:15,011
I left your old room
like it was.

556
01:08:16,304 --> 01:08:19,140
You can sleep here tonight.

557
01:08:19,182 --> 01:08:21,851
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
01:08:21,851 --> 01:08:25,355
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
01:08:26,731 --> 01:08:30,068
-Is that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
01:08:30,151 --> 01:08:33,154
That clock's kept perfect time
since I bought it.

561
01:08:33,196 --> 01:08:34,864
A.M. or P.M.?

562
01:08:36,950 --> 01:08:39,994
-What do you think?
-I don't understand.

563
01:08:39,994 --> 01:08:43,498
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
01:08:43,540 --> 01:08:46,668
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
01:08:48,753 --> 01:08:50,005
Get some sleep.

566
01:08:50,005 --> 01:08:53,133
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
01:09:33,256 --> 01:09:34,841
Come on...

568
01:10:00,325 --> 01:10:04,079
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
01:10:04,120 --> 01:10:07,123
I know. He's not himself.

570
01:10:07,165 --> 01:10:09,709
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

571
01:10:09,751 --> 01:10:12,587
-I'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
01:10:17,008 --> 01:10:21,221
I can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
01:10:22,180 --> 01:10:25,725
We just wanted to help.

574
01:10:34,109 --> 01:10:38,655
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
01:10:38,697 --> 01:10:43,034
If you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
01:10:44,869 --> 01:10:47,997
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
01:12:21,216 --> 01:12:27,055
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
01:12:33,103 --> 01:12:36,064
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
01:12:36,106 --> 01:12:40,610
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
01:12:40,652 --> 01:12:42,320
What are you talking about?

581
01:12:42,362 --> 01:12:46,241
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
01:12:46,282 --> 01:12:50,954
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
01:12:51,037 --> 01:12:56,084
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
01:12:56,126 --> 01:12:59,921
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
01:13:00,005 --> 01:13:05,468
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
01:13:05,510 --> 01:13:09,889
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
01:13:10,890 --> 01:13:13,601
I understand you now.

588
01:13:13,601 --> 01:13:18,148
I remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
01:13:18,189 --> 01:13:25,071
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
01:13:25,113 --> 01:13:30,785
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
01:13:31,995 --> 01:13:35,915
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
01:13:35,957 --> 01:13:39,210
We use your dead as vessels.

593
01:16:21,289 --> 01:16:22,540
Get in!

594
01:16:41,893 --> 01:16:46,773
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when I left her.

595
01:16:46,815 --> 01:16:50,652
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
01:16:50,694 --> 01:16:53,446
It must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
01:16:53,488 --> 01:16:54,739
What pictures?

598
01:16:56,574 --> 01:17:00,161
-I don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
01:17:00,245 --> 01:17:03,289
-Stop telling me lies.
-I am not telling lies!

600
01:17:03,373 --> 01:17:06,292
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
01:17:06,334 --> 01:17:12,549
I have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
01:17:12,590 --> 01:17:16,761
You think it makes sense to me?
I'm as confused as you are.

603
01:17:16,803 --> 01:17:21,725
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
01:17:21,766 --> 01:17:24,436
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
01:17:24,477 --> 01:17:26,563
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
01:17:27,272 --> 01:17:33,862
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
01:17:33,903 --> 01:17:35,947
Give me a second, will you?

608
01:17:38,408 --> 01:17:40,368
You can't remember, can you?

609
01:17:42,162 --> 01:17:45,290
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
01:17:46,791 --> 01:17:49,377
Wait. I got a better one.

611
01:17:49,461 --> 01:17:54,132
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
01:17:54,924 --> 01:17:58,636
-What do you mean?
-I just mean during the day.

613
01:18:00,138 --> 01:18:03,558
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
01:18:03,641 --> 01:18:08,271
I'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
01:18:08,313 --> 01:18:11,775
I mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:18:12,942 --> 01:18:15,153
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:18:17,405 --> 01:18:19,532
You don't, do you?

618
01:18:19,574 --> 01:18:26,498
I don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:18:26,581 --> 01:18:31,795
'Cause I've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:18:32,504 --> 01:18:35,382
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:18:35,423 --> 01:18:39,928
But listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

622
01:18:39,969 --> 01:18:43,598
It's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:18:43,682 --> 01:18:46,017
Shut up.
I've heard enough.

624
01:18:46,017 --> 01:18:49,437
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:19:02,492 --> 01:19:05,995
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:19:15,213 --> 01:19:16,423
Explain this.

627
01:19:43,742 --> 01:19:45,618
I'm so sorry.

628
01:19:46,953 --> 01:19:50,665
I never meant to hurt you.
I don't know why I did.

629
01:19:50,665 --> 01:19:52,917
I wish I could take it back.

630
01:19:53,793 --> 01:19:56,671
You didn't do it.

631
01:19:56,713 --> 01:19:58,840
This affair of yours,

632
01:19:58,882 --> 01:20:02,719
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:20:02,761 --> 01:20:04,262
I don't believe it happened.

634
01:20:04,304 --> 01:20:09,059
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:20:09,100 --> 01:20:13,021
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:20:13,063 --> 01:20:20,862
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:20:20,904 --> 01:20:24,324
And everything you remember,

638
01:20:24,407 --> 01:20:28,411
and everything I'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:20:28,453 --> 01:20:31,539
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:20:32,749 --> 01:20:34,626
But how can that be true?

641
01:20:35,377 --> 01:20:39,130
I so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:20:40,757 --> 01:20:43,718
I remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:20:45,720 --> 01:20:49,432
-I remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:20:51,393 --> 01:20:57,399
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:21:05,532 --> 01:21:07,409
I love you, John.

646
01:21:11,663 --> 01:21:14,374
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:21:16,459 --> 01:21:18,336
No, you can't.

648
01:21:54,956 --> 01:21:58,126
Inspector? Sir?

649
01:21:59,919 --> 01:22:03,298
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:22:06,217 --> 01:22:07,969
I thought you should know.

651
01:22:11,264 --> 01:22:16,686
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:22:25,362 --> 01:22:27,697
I knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:22:47,092 --> 01:22:48,510
Shoelace.

654
01:23:04,984 --> 01:23:08,947
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:23:13,201 --> 01:23:15,328
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:23:20,041 --> 01:23:21,501
Evening.

657
01:23:37,600 --> 01:23:42,105
I wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:23:45,316 --> 01:23:48,862
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:23:48,903 --> 01:23:50,155
Sleep.

660
01:24:28,276 --> 01:24:30,278
I knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:24:30,320 --> 01:24:33,448
Isn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:24:35,116 --> 01:24:38,536
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:24:42,624 --> 01:24:44,959
I come here often.

664
01:24:45,001 --> 01:24:48,213
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed some peace.

665
01:24:48,755 --> 01:24:52,592
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:24:53,843 --> 01:24:56,346
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:24:56,888 --> 01:25:00,183
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:25:00,225 --> 01:25:01,476
Right.

669
01:25:02,394 --> 01:25:08,274
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:25:08,316 --> 01:25:10,151
We all are.

671
01:25:12,237 --> 01:25:19,536
I'm sorry, but I have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:25:19,577 --> 01:25:24,582
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:25:24,624 --> 01:25:29,087
I need you to inject yourself.
It's the only way to understand.

674
01:25:29,129 --> 01:25:32,674
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:25:32,716 --> 01:25:37,262
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:25:37,303 --> 01:25:40,015
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:25:40,056 --> 01:25:43,685
I may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:25:43,727 --> 01:25:47,439
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:25:47,480 --> 01:25:50,608
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:25:52,110 --> 01:25:57,032
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:25:59,159 --> 01:26:03,079
All the answers you've been
looking for, I swear to you.

682
01:26:05,498 --> 01:26:12,714
Guess I'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:26:12,714 --> 01:26:14,424
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:26:16,343 --> 01:26:20,305
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:26:20,847 --> 01:26:23,016
Shell Beach.

686
01:26:24,392 --> 01:26:28,730
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:26:39,783 --> 01:26:44,037
Won't find anything there.
I've been there--

688
01:26:44,079 --> 01:26:46,998
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:26:47,082 --> 01:26:51,670
I won't. I refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:26:51,711 --> 01:26:54,714
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:27:06,351 --> 01:27:11,940
I don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:27:18,655 --> 01:27:22,534
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:27:22,575 --> 01:27:24,828
Don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

694
01:27:24,869 --> 01:27:27,038
It doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:27:35,672 --> 01:27:36,923
What?

696
01:27:41,136 --> 01:27:43,054
Who are you people?

697
01:27:43,596 --> 01:27:47,058
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:27:48,685 --> 01:27:51,980
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:27:53,440 --> 01:27:56,359
-Anna.
-I'm not Anna.

700
01:27:58,445 --> 01:28:00,989
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:28:06,327 --> 01:28:09,873
I have another use
for her first.

702
01:28:21,760 --> 01:28:24,095
I call them Strangers.

703
01:28:24,804 --> 01:28:27,891
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:28:29,351 --> 01:28:34,939
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:28:34,939 --> 01:28:38,318
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:28:38,360 --> 01:28:41,696
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:28:42,322 --> 01:28:45,867
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:28:45,950 --> 01:28:49,412
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:28:49,913 --> 01:28:54,167
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:28:54,209 --> 01:28:59,798
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:28:59,839 --> 01:29:05,178
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:29:05,220 --> 01:29:07,555
even a lost wallet.

713
01:29:07,639 --> 01:29:10,266
Then they observe the results.

714
01:29:11,851 --> 01:29:17,065
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:29:17,691 --> 01:29:22,153
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:29:22,237 --> 01:29:27,909
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:29:28,743 --> 01:29:31,955
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:29:32,038 --> 01:29:33,790
You happened to wake up...

719
01:29:33,832 --> 01:29:37,377
while I was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:29:37,460 --> 01:29:39,879
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:29:40,005 --> 01:29:45,176
It is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:29:45,218 --> 01:29:47,512
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:29:47,512 --> 01:29:50,640
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:29:50,640 --> 01:29:54,019
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:29:54,060 --> 01:29:59,649
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:29:59,691 --> 01:30:05,822
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:30:05,864 --> 01:30:09,617
-They think we can save them.
-Where do I fit in?

728
01:30:09,659 --> 01:30:15,331
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:30:21,504 --> 01:30:25,842
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:30:25,884 --> 01:30:29,929
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:30:30,013 --> 01:30:33,600
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:30:33,641 --> 01:30:38,063
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:30:39,022 --> 01:30:42,317
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:30:42,359 --> 01:30:46,321
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:30:46,363 --> 01:30:48,198
Why do they need you?

736
01:30:48,239 --> 01:30:50,700
When they first brought us here,

737
01:30:50,700 --> 01:30:56,122
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:30:56,164 --> 01:30:58,583
remixed it like paint...

739
01:30:58,625 --> 01:31:01,753
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:31:01,795 --> 01:31:06,341
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:31:08,510 --> 01:31:14,724
I understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:31:14,766 --> 01:31:19,270
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:31:19,312 --> 01:31:21,147
because they needed them.

744
01:31:21,189 --> 01:31:24,234
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:31:34,953 --> 01:31:40,542
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:31:40,583 --> 01:31:44,671
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:31:45,755 --> 01:31:48,341
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:31:49,884 --> 01:31:54,973
What about this?
This was blank when I found it.

749
01:31:55,015 --> 01:31:59,894
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:31:59,936 --> 01:32:01,563
Not in this place.

751
01:32:01,604 --> 01:32:05,191
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:32:05,233 --> 01:32:07,527
as it is with all of us.

753
01:32:07,610 --> 01:32:10,739
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:32:10,780 --> 01:32:12,657
You say they brought us here.

755
01:32:15,618 --> 01:32:16,870
From where?

756
01:32:21,708 --> 01:32:25,670
I'm sorry. I don't remember.

757
01:32:26,713 --> 01:32:32,010
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:32:32,052 --> 01:32:36,473
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:32:58,745 --> 01:33:03,416
I've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:33:03,500 --> 01:33:04,668
Let's go.

761
01:34:01,474 --> 01:34:04,269
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:34:05,895 --> 01:34:08,565
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:34:10,567 --> 01:34:13,695
The only place home exists...

764
01:34:16,489 --> 01:34:18,450
is in your head.

765
01:34:32,756 --> 01:34:34,007
Stop!

766
01:34:50,357 --> 01:34:51,608
Please!

767
01:35:17,676 --> 01:35:20,345
Now you know the truth.

768
01:36:34,794 --> 01:36:38,131
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:36:38,173 --> 01:36:41,051
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:36:41,092 --> 01:36:42,594
What do I care?

771
01:36:43,178 --> 01:36:45,805
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:36:45,847 --> 01:36:51,686
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:36:51,728 --> 01:36:57,067
I have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:36:59,486 --> 01:37:03,948
Shall I end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:37:08,370 --> 01:37:15,001
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:37:17,754 --> 01:37:18,963
Sleep.

777
01:37:21,675 --> 01:37:22,842
Now.

778
01:37:46,991 --> 01:37:48,243
Sleep.

779
01:37:59,546 --> 01:38:01,297
Kill him.

780
01:38:01,339 --> 01:38:02,590
Kill him !

781
01:38:15,770 --> 01:38:20,108
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:38:20,150 --> 01:38:24,320
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:38:24,362 --> 01:38:28,324
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:38:28,408 --> 01:38:33,329
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:38:33,413 --> 01:38:36,875
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:38:36,958 --> 01:38:41,171
The time for study is over.

787
01:38:41,171 --> 01:38:46,593
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:38:55,143 --> 01:38:59,314
It is time, Doctor. Imprint.

789
01:39:02,650 --> 01:39:05,362
Shut it down!

790
01:39:06,488 --> 01:39:09,532
Shut it down forever.

791
01:39:27,842 --> 01:39:29,177
What are you doing?

792
01:39:30,345 --> 01:39:36,226
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:39:37,560 --> 01:39:40,355
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:39:40,397 --> 01:39:43,108
so they can share your soul.

795
01:39:43,149 --> 01:39:46,069
But I've got other plans.

796
01:39:50,281 --> 01:39:53,910
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:39:53,952 --> 01:39:59,749
I'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:40:13,638 --> 01:40:15,807
Remember, John.

799
01:40:17,058 --> 01:40:19,602
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:40:19,644 --> 01:40:22,731
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:40:24,399 --> 01:40:25,608
Remember.

802
01:40:27,318 --> 01:40:30,864
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:40:30,905 --> 01:40:34,993
Now, remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:40:35,452 --> 01:40:37,120
John, remember.

805
01:40:37,370 --> 01:40:40,874
You're probably wondering why I
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:40:40,915 --> 01:40:43,960
It's because I have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:40:44,002 --> 01:40:48,965
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:40:49,007 --> 01:40:52,927
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:40:56,473 --> 01:41:02,312
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:41:02,354 --> 01:41:04,272
And you will prevail.

811
01:41:05,106 --> 01:41:06,524
Remember.

812
01:41:07,400 --> 01:41:10,236
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:41:13,865 --> 01:41:19,037
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day I'll work for you.

814
01:41:19,829 --> 01:41:24,334
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:41:24,417 --> 01:41:26,586
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:41:26,628 --> 01:41:30,715
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:41:30,757 --> 01:41:36,513
I know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:41:39,057 --> 01:41:40,558
Something's wrong.

819
01:41:51,569 --> 01:41:53,905
There is no time for romance.

820
01:41:53,947 --> 01:41:56,574
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:41:57,826 --> 01:41:59,160
What have you done?

822
01:42:00,537 --> 01:42:03,206
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:42:03,289 --> 01:42:05,709
but you must act now.

824
01:48:01,064 --> 01:48:06,403
I knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:48:06,486 --> 01:48:09,322
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:48:10,740 --> 01:48:16,329
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:48:16,329 --> 01:48:19,207
-So give her back her memories.
-I can't.

828
01:48:19,249 --> 01:48:24,337
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:48:25,338 --> 01:48:26,589
I'm sorry.

830
01:48:28,383 --> 01:48:30,802
What are you going to do now?

831
01:48:34,556 --> 01:48:36,433
I'm gonna fix things.

832
01:48:38,476 --> 01:48:42,605
You told me I had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:48:43,815 --> 01:48:47,485
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

834
01:48:48,820 --> 01:48:51,364
Make this world
anything I want it to be.

835
01:48:52,907 --> 01:48:57,996
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:50:42,559 --> 01:50:44,144
Where are you going?

837
01:50:48,440 --> 01:50:49,691
Shell Beach.

838
01:51:41,409 --> 01:51:43,286
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:51:51,753 --> 01:51:53,922
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:51:55,548 --> 01:51:56,800
Thank you.

841
01:52:54,315 --> 01:52:56,776
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:52:57,652 --> 01:53:03,033
-What are you doing?
-I'm just making a few changes.

843
01:53:03,074 --> 01:53:09,205
-We're sure that's what we want?
-I'll take my chances.

844
01:53:09,289 --> 01:53:16,504
I'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:53:16,588 --> 01:53:19,299
But I wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:53:21,426 --> 01:53:23,470
How you feel.

847
01:53:23,553 --> 01:53:26,890
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

848
01:53:26,931 --> 01:53:32,062
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:53:32,103 --> 01:53:36,107
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:53:37,484 --> 01:53:42,238
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:53:44,240 --> 01:53:46,493
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:55:50,533 --> 01:55:52,786
It's so beautiful here.

853
01:55:59,584 --> 01:56:01,169
So bright.

854
01:56:09,052 --> 01:56:11,596
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:56:12,514 --> 01:56:15,517
I think that's it over there.

856
01:56:38,289 --> 01:56:40,792
I'm headed that way myself.

857
01:56:43,294 --> 01:56:44,963
Would you like to join me?

858
01:56:48,925 --> 01:56:50,135
Sure.

859
01:56:56,933 --> 01:57:01,396
I'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?
